Detailed Description

Representation of a single sound sample.

The only was to instantiate this class is to use the add() method of class Sound.

Member Function Documentation

virtual float duration (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Computes this sample duration.

Returns:
duration in seconds.

virtual bool pause (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Pauses the samples if it is playing.

Returns:
true on success, false if some error occured.

virtual bool play (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Plays the sample.

Returns:
true on success, false if some error occured.

virtual bool prepare (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Prepares the sample to be played.

This is equivalent to calling pause() just after calling play(). It allows to prepare multiple samples to be played at the same time by calling resume() once they are all prepared, e.g: 

 Sample *sample1 = sound->load(...);      // <sound> type is Sound*
 Sample *sample2 = sound->load(...);
 sample1->prepare();
 sample2->prepare();
 sound->resume();     // <sample1> and <sample2> start playing together
Returns:
true on success, false if some error occured.

virtual bool resume (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Resumes playing of the sample if it was previously paused.

Returns:
true on success, false if some error occured.

virtual bool setLoopMode (  bool  loop  )  const [pure virtual]
 

Sets the loop mode.

If loop = true, the sample will loop, else it will just play once.

Returns:
true on success, false if some error occured.

virtual bool stop (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Stops playing the sample.

Returns:
true on success, false if some error occured.
